Internet
On
Mars

A new connection approaches on Mars

LI-FI AND WI-FI

From the emission of radio waves and light, which are the basic principles that move Wi-Fi and Li-Fi, FTLC can receive signals that are sent from Earth with a satellite that will be near Mars. The satellite will convert the received data into laser beams for a signal tower on the Red Planet.

After Mars properly receives the signal in its transmission tower, the signal is now converted once again to Wi-Fi and Li-Fi, in addition to having the transmission over Internet cables, so that the data can be accessed in different ways by the population living on the planet. 

HOW POWERFUL LI-FI IS?

Li-Fi is an innovative technology developed and demonstrated by Dr. Hass at the University of Edinburg in 2011 and 2012, a technology that allows transmitting data through lighting, where in his first experiments, a LED lamp was used, which can have intensity variations much faster than the human eye can capture, to stream a video in HD.
Besides being safer than radio waves, the Li-Fi signal can also reach places where it was not possible to transmit data quickly and safely before, such as power plants, airlines and medical rooms in hospitals, all data can be transmitted from small light bulbs.

By combining Wi-Fi with Li-Fi, it is possible to have a much wider range of transmission than the Earth uses today, because while there is light, Li-Fi can be transmitted, in dead communication zones where Wi-Fi signals do not arrive, the light can be used to replace and bring the new Age of Data.
